text: Two papers accepted to InfoVis 2016 -- HindSight with Mia and PROACT with Anzu!
Travel! Recent talks at Pacific Northwest National Lab, BostonCHI at IBM Research, Keene State, and Smith.

Workshop paper with R. Jordan Crouser, Daniel Afergan, and Evan Peck accepted to ACM IUI 2016, Workshop on Emotion and Visualization - "Beyond Detection: Investing in Practical and Theoretical Applications of Emotion and Visualization"

Update: Best Paper Award! Also covered in New Scientist and FastCompany Paper with Beste Yuksel accepted to CHI 2016: Learn Piano with BACh: An Adaptive Learning Interface that Adjusts Task Difficulty based on Brain State.
Paper with Alvitta Ottley accepted to IEEE InfoVis: Improving Bayesian Reasoning: The Effects of Phrasing, Visualization, and Spatial Ability.
Alyssa Tsiros receives an Honorable Mention in the BioVis 2015 Design Contest for her work in visualizing ncRNA structural evolution.
I've joined Worcester Polytechnic Institute as an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science.
Paper on the effect of visual embellishments in bar charts accepted to EuroVis 2015.
Teaching Biovisualization at Worcester Polytechnic Institute this winter/spring.
Speaking on User-Centered Visualization Research at OpenVisConf 2015, April 6-7.
Paper on information graphics and aesthetic judgments accepted to CHI 2015 in Seoul, Korea.
Discussed VizSec 2014 and the future of security visualization on the Data Driven Security Podcast.
Presented our paper on visualizations of correlation and Weber's law at IEEE VIS in Paris. (A short summary, and a longer one here.)
Serving as General Chair for VizSec (Visualization for Cyber Security) 2015.
Hosted 8 excellent IEEE VIS preview talks at Tufts, including authors from Brown, Harvard, and MIT.
Spoke on "User Centered Visualization" at the Boston DataVis Meetup hosted by Bocoup.
Invited talk at Charles River Analytics.
Paper on evaluation and security visualizations accepted to VizSec 2014.
Appointed as Instructor at Tufts for the Visualization (CS) course.
Paper on leveraging perception to rank visualization effectiveness accepted to IEEE InfoVis and TVCG 2014.
